title: 32-B
statement: B. Borzetime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutTernary numeric notation is quite popular in Berland. To telegraph the ternary number the Borze alphabet is used. Digit 0 is transmitted as«.», 1 as«-.»and 2 as«--». You are to decode the Borze code, i.e. to find out the ternary number given its representation in Borze alphabet.InputThe first line contains a number in Borze code. The length of the string is between 1 and 200 characters. It's guaranteed that the given string is a valid Borze code of some ternary number (this number can have leading zeroes).OutputOutput the decoded ternary number. It can have leading zeroes.ExamplesInput.-.--Output012Input--.Output20Input-..-.--Output1012

processed.result:
Given a string representing a number in a special code where:

* 0 is represented as "<<"
* 1 is represented as "-."
* 2 is represented as "--"

Decode the string to find the original ternary number. 

The input string will be between 1 and 200 characters long and will always be a valid code. The output should be the decoded ternary number, which may have leading zeros.
Convert a code made up of "«.»", «-.» and «--» into a number using the following key: «.» = 0, «-.» = 1, «--» = 2.
